thread.title: WorldStarHipHop Founder Lee “Q” O’Denat Has Reportedly Died
thread.title_full: WorldStarHipHop Founder Lee “Q” O’Denat Has Reportedly Died

author: Alec Banks
title: WorldStarHipHop Founder Lee “Q” O’Denat Has Reportedly Died
text:
According to TMZ , WorldStarHipHop founder, Lee “Q” O’Denat, died in his sleep on Monday night at the age of 43. Sources told them he died of a heart attack, but an autopsy is still pending.
In a 2015 New York Times profile , O’Denat explained his vision for the infamous site that often promoted overt violence, stating, “Hip-hop is for the sex, the drugs, the violence, the beefs, the culture. That’s the competitiveness of hip-hop, so I felt like the site needed to be R-rated.”
This news comes only two weeks after it was reported that WorldStarHipHop was making the jump to television with a deal on MTV 2 to produce a show where comedians, correspondents and cultural tastemakers would provide commentary on some of the most viral clips from the web portal.
Stay tuned for more details.
